title: The two reasons Man Utd expect to complete James Maddison transfer
text:
Manchester United expect to sign James Maddison from Leicester City (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United are optimistic of signing James Maddison from Leicester City as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer looks to overhaul his squad over the next two transfer windows.

Despite spending close to £150million on Harry Maguire, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Daniel James last summer, the Red Devils have endured a dismal start to the new season.

After nine games, Solskjaer’s side find themselves 14th in the Premier League, just two points above the relegation zone and with just one win since the opening weekend.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants to sign at least four players over the next two windows (Picture: AP)

It has been claimed that Solskjaer wants Manchester United to bring at least four new players to Old Trafford over the next two windows, and Maddison has emerged as a key target.

The Red Devils expressed interest in signing the Leicester playmaker during the summer and he has enjoyed a fine start to the campaign, scoring three goals in nine matches.

United reportedly baulked at Leicester’s valuation of Maddison over the summer but are confident that they will strike a deal with their Premier League rivals either in January or next summer.

According to the Manchester Evening News, Old Trafford chiefs believe the fact that Maddison is a boyhood United fan and close friends with Maguire will prove pivotal in the pursuit.

United, it is claimed, believe Maguire was swayed by England team-mates Marcus Rashford and Jesse Lingard ahead of his £80m move, and it is hoped a similar pattern will play out for Maddison.

Solskjaer made a point of targeting young, domestic players in the summer and that policy looks set to continue over the next year as he bids to bring back the glory days to Old Trafford.

Manchester United were beaten by relegation-battlers Newcastle before the international break but produced an improved performance against Premier League leaders Liverpool last weekend.

The Red Devils looked set to end Liverpool’s unbeaten run through Marcus Rashford’s first-half opener, but Adam Lallana came off the bench to rescue Jurgen Klopp a point with a late equaliser.

On Thursday, Manchester United resume their Europa League campaign against Serbian outfit Partizan Belgrade before facing Norwich City over the weekend.
